174.article_body: NATO said it will ensure the Russia-Ukraine conflict doesn't spread to other countries. "We have a responsibility to ensure the conflict does not escalate and spread beyond Ukraine," NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg said. "We will protect and defend every inch of all allied territory," he added. Meanwhile, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he will no longer press for NATO membership.

175.title: We have to be patient: GT's Director of Cricket on Pandya's fitness
175.article_body: Gujarat Titans' Director of Cricket Vikram Solanki has said their captain Hardik Pandya is on his path to recovery and playing a full part but they have to be patient with the demands. "Hardik is working extremely hard in all aspects of his game...He's conscious that he has to get up to speed with batting, bowling and fielding," added Vikram.

176.title: Told him not to assume I'd do anything for him: Sham on Vicky joining B'wood
176.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal's father Sham Kaushal, who's a renowned action director in Bollywood, recalled how he couldn't refuse Vicky when he said he wanted to join the films soon after clearing his engineering course. Sham said he explained to Vicky that he shouldn't assume his father would do anything for him, in fact, he had to earn his position.

177.title: WB Speaker rejects Governor's request to meet over ruckus in Assembly
177.article_body: West Bengal Assembly Speaker Biman Banerjee rejected Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar's request to meet over ruckus in the Assembly. "Urged Speaker for a meeting...in view of 'unseemly ruckus and chaotic spectacle unfolded in the hallowed precincts of the Assembly on March 7'," Dhankhar tweeted. The Speaker rejected the request saying he was preoccupied due to the ongoing Assembly session, ANI reported.

178.title: Delhi cabinet gives approval for restructuring, strengthening DDC
178.article_body: The Delhi government has approved the proposal for restructuring and strengthening its policy think tank, the Dialogue and Development Commission (DDC), its Vice-Chairperson Jasmine Shah said on Tuesday. The commission will now have 48 sanctioned posts. Out of these, 26 policy makers from several domains from across the world will be employed on a contractual basis, Shah added.

179.title: People come to watch so-called good-looking stars in glossy films: Tandav actor
179.article_body: 'Tandav' actor Mohd Zeeshan Ayyub said it's unfortunate that good actors aren't getting good roles. He added, "If it's a glossy film selling dream, then...people come to watch the so-called good-looking stars." "It's also a part of our conditioning that only fair people look good," Ayyub said. He further added that things are changing now because of OTT.

180.title: GSK and MS Dhoni team up for 6 in 1 vaccination awareness campaign
180.article_body: GSK launches a new public interest campaign featuring MS Dhoni, to raise awareness about the need for prevention of 6 diseases with just 1 vaccination. The awareness film, featuring Dhoni, draws parallel between hitting a six in cricket and '6 in 1' vaccination for infants. The campaign's tagline, 'Less injections, less pain' encapsulates the key benefits of this combination vaccination.

181.title: Everyone said I should lose some weight after my 1st Kannada film: Meghana Raj
181.article_body: Actress Meghana Raj said that everybody started telling her to "lose some weight" after her first Kannada film. "But the Malayalam industry had accepted me exactly the way I was...in 'Beautiful'...my skin was really bad...I had weight issues...my director [told me] 'I do not want you to put makeup'." Meghana said that she often felt something was wrong with her.

182.title: Man poses as police officer, extorts money from spas in Pune; held
182.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Police arrested 28-year-old real estate agent, Vishal Jaunjale, for allegedly posing as a police officer and extorting money from spas and massage parlours by claiming he had recorded videos on premises. Jaunjale was asking for ₹1 lakh after allegedly shooting video at spa. Police got spa owner to arrange a meeting with him at a restaurant and caught him.

183.title: 3 constables injured as explosives explode while defusing in Raigad
183.article_body: Two police constables of the Bomb Detection and Disposal Squad (BDDS) were seriously injured while another suffered minor injuries after explosives that were being disposed of suddenly exploded. The incident occurred on Tuesday in Maharashtra's Raigad district. "The BDDS team was disposing of explosives recovered in a case of 2013. The explosives included gelatin and detonators," an official said.

184.title: Russia's rating cut for 2nd time in a week by Fitch
184.article_body: Russia's sovereign rating has been downgraded by six notches to the second lowest level of 'C' by Fitch Ratings, which said that a bond default is "imminent". "This rating action follows our downgrade...to 'B'/Rating Watch Negative on 2 March," it said. "Developments since then have...further undermined Russia's willingness to service government debt," the rating agency added amid sanctions.

185.title: India reports 4,575 new COVID-19 cases, 14.5% higher than yesterday
185.article_body: India has reported 4,575 new COVID-19 cases and 145 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,993 cases and 108 deaths. Out of the 145 deaths, 45 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 100 were reconciled deaths in Kerala.

186.title: India's 1st women-owned industrial park opens in Hyderabad
186.article_body: India's first 100% women-owned industrial park called FLO Industrial Park began operations in Hyderabad's Sultanpur on Tuesday. "The park promoted by FICCI Ladies Organization (FLO) in partnership with Telangana government, has announced the commencement of operations," Telangana IT and Industries Minister KT Rama Rao said. The park has been set up in 50 acres with an investment of ₹250 crore.

187.title: 'Mankading' no longer 'unfair play' as cricket laws amended
187.article_body: In MCC's 'The Laws of Cricket 2017 Code (3rd Edition - 2022)', 'mankading' has been moved from Law 41 (Unfair play) to Law 38 (Run-out). MCC said that the wording of the law will remain the same. 'Mankad' is a rare form of dismissal wherein a bowler runs out non-striker after the latter leaves crease even before ball is delivered.

188.title: Liverpool reach Champions League quarters with 2-1 aggregate win vs Inter
188.article_body: Liverpool suffered 0-1 defeat to Inter Milan in the Champions League last-16 second leg but advanced to the quarterfinals with a 2-1 aggregate in the tie. Lautaro Martinez put Inter ahead in the 61st minute but they were reduced to 10 men after Alexis Sanchez was sent off moments later. This was Liverpool's first defeat in the competition this season.

189.title: 32-year-old carpenter in Pune robbed by 2 men posing as customers
189.article_body: A 32-year-old carpenter was allegedly robbed by two men who claimed to be customers and called him to a secluded spot on the pretext of giving him work, police said. When the victim reached the location, the accused allegedly threatened to kill him and robbed him of ₹5,000 cash, and also forced him to transfer ₹42,800 using various UPI-based e-wallets.

190.title: I've done my best to lead NSE in a difficult period: CEO on not seeking 2nd term
190.article_body: National Stock Exchange (NSE) MD & CEO Vikram Limaye said that he won't apply for a second term as his first five-year term ends in July 2022. "I've done my best to lead the organisation in a very difficult period and to stabilise, strengthen and transform NSE," he added. Earlier, NSE published an advertisement calling for candidates for CEO role.

191.title: Exit polls of Punjab are far from reality: Congress' Harish Rawat
191.article_body: As exit polls predicted that AAP will be getting the majority in Punjab Assembly polls, Congress leader Harish Rawat said that the exit polls are far from reality. "How would AAP get votes where it never exists? Congress is coming with a good mandate. I have full faith that we will form our government there (Punjab)," Rawat added.

192.title: Robert Vadra under-reported ₹106 cr income over 11 years: I-T Department
192.article_body: Businessman and husband of Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Robert Vadra, under-reported his income from benami properties by ₹106 crore over 11 years from assessment years 2010-11 to 2020-21, claimed the Income Tax Department. The Department further alleged that seven companies owned by him also under-reported income by about ₹9 crore over assessment years 2010-11 to 2015-16.

193.title: Under PM Modi, India more likely to respond to Pak provocations: US Intelligence
193.article_body: Under Prime Minister Narendra Modi, India is more likely than in the past to respond with military force to any real or perceived Pakistani provocations, the US Intelligence Community has told the US Congress. "Pakistan has a long history of supporting anti-India militant groups...and each side's perception of heightened tensions raises the risk of conflict," it said.

194.title: Congress deploys senior leaders in Uttarakhand ahead of poll results
194.article_body: Ahead of the counting of votes in Uttarakhand, the AICC on Tuesday deployed senior Congress leaders in 13 districts of the state in order to coordinate with the party candidates. The party has sent senior leaders including party MPs, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel and AICC office-bearers. Other leaders include Congress MP Deepender Singh Hooda, AICC observer Mohan Prakash among others.

195.title: Amazon cloud unit stops taking new customers in Russia, Belarus
195.article_body: Amazon's cloud-computing unit AWS is no longer accepting new sign-ups based in Russia or Belarus, the firm announced. Amazon said the AWS unit had "no data centers, infrastructure or offices in Russia, and we have a long-standing policy of not doing business with the Russian government". AWS' biggest customers in Russia are companies with headquarters outside of the country.

196.title: Action to be taken against firms not prioritising locals: K'taka minister
196.article_body: Karnataka minister Murugesh R Nirani said action will be taken against companies if they fail to prioritise jobs for Kannadigas or those native to the southern state. "As per a clause in the 2020-25 Industrial Policy, the individual units must provide 100% jobs in D group and 70% of total jobs to Kannadigas," Nirani said in the legislative council.

197.title: K'taka govt launches programme to provide 5 lakh jobs to women till 2026
197.article_body: Karnataka government launched Women@Work (W@W) programme on Tuesday with an aim to provide five lakh jobs to women till 2026. The initiative which would contribute to the country's GDP growth is a part of Karnataka's Digital Economy Mission. Women will also be given free certificate courses as a part of this programme to train them technically in various disciplines.

198.title: Russia announces ceasefire in Ukraine for Wednesday morning
198.article_body: Russia has announced a humanitarian ceasefire in Ukraine starting at 10 am Moscow time on Wednesday for the evacuation of civilians. Russia has declared a 'regime of silence' and is reportedly ready to provide humanitarian corridors from a number of cities including Kyiv, Chernihiv, Sumy, Kharkiv, Mariupol, and Zaporizhzhia. On Tuesday, civilian evacuations took place from Sumy.

199.title: Chandigarh Police launches women patrol vehicles on Women's Day
199.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, Chandigarh Police launched women patrolling vehicles in the city. The patrol vehicles were flagged off during a cultural-cum-educative programme at the Government College for Girls in Sector 42, on Tuesday. The cyber interns of Chandigarh Police also spread awareness about cyber security for women during the programme.

200.title: TN farmer ends life after firm seizes tractor for loan default
200.article_body: A 23-year-old farmer from Tamil Nadu's Viluppuram district died allegedly by suicide after agents of a private finance company seized one of his tractors and insulted him and his family for defaulting a loan. Police have registered a case against two employees of the firm. "The family wants monetary compensation, a loan waiver and return of tractor," said an official.

201.title: Lewandowski's 11-minute hat-trick help Bayern advance in Champions League
201.article_body: Robert Lewandowski scored three times in 11 minutes as Bayern Munich advanced to the Champions League quarterfinals with a 7-1 win over FC Salzburg. The German club won the last-16 tie 8-2 on aggregate after a 1-1 draw in Salzburg last month. Notably, Lewandowski's hat-trick inside 23 minutes from kick-off was the fastest in Champions League history.

202.title: EVMs were for training: EC after Akhilesh claims machines 'stolen' in Varanasi
202.article_body: Uttar Pradesh's Chief Electoral Officer (CEO) has issued a statement after Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday alleged that EVMs were being stolen in Varanasi. "In the investigation, it has been found that these EVMs were marked for training," the CEO said. EVMs were being transported to train the officials involved in counting duty, the CEO added.

203.title: I wasn't willing to do 'Kahaani'; had no idea it'll be a hit: Nawazuddin
203.article_body: Nawazuddin Siddiqui said he's proud he did 'Kahaani' as the film changed his career. He added initially, he didn't have any idea that the film will be a hit. "Actually, I wasn't [willing to do] 'Kahaani'," he said. "Sujoy (director) called...and...set up a meeting at a restaurant...where he showed me a documentary, following which I got interested," he added.

204.title: SP leader Azam Khan gets bail in defamation case, to stay in jail
204.article_body: The Allahabad High Court has granted bail to Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan in a defamation case lodged against him in 2019. "The complainant has alleged that Azam Khan had attempted to disrupt the image of cleric Maulana Kalbe Jawad by issuing false statements," said Khan's lawyer. Khan, who has been booked in multiple cases, will remain in jail.

205.title: 2 post offices in Pune declared 'all-women' on International Women's Day
205.article_body: In a first for Pune, two post offices in city, Pune Cantonment (east) and Dr BA chowk, were declared women post offices on occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. Four women staffers each will manage all postal operations at post offices. "This initiative aims at offering more ease for women customers to interact with women staffers," an official said.

206.title: After McDonald's, Coca-Cola, Pepsi & Starbucks suspend business in Russia
206.article_body: After McDonald's announced that it's temporarily shutting around 850 restaurants in Russia, Starbucks, Coca-Cola, PepsiCo and General Electric have suspended operations in the country. However, PepsiCo will continue to sell essentials like milk and baby food. Cereal manufacturer Kellogg's, KFC parent Yum Brands and Kraft Heinz are suspending their investment into Russia amid Ukraine invasion.

207.title: Pakistan national thanks Indian embassy and PM Modi for rescuing her in Ukraine
207.article_body: A video has surfaced online which shows a Pakistan woman named Asma Shafique thanking the Indian embassy in Kyiv and Prime Minister Narendra Modi for rescuing her "from a difficult situation" in war-torn Ukraine. She was rescued by the Indian authorities and is on her way to Western Ukraine for evacuation out of the country, ANI reported.

208.title: What are the new rules of cricket announced by MCC?
208.article_body: As per new cricket laws announced by MCC, cricketers won't be allowed to use saliva on ball. 'Mankading' has been removed from 'unfair play' section to 'run-out'. New batters will face next delivery after a player is given out caught even if batters have crossed before catch is taken. Wides will be judged based on where batters are standing.

209.title: 3 wanted in 14 cases of house thefts arrested in B'luru; 1.12 kg gold seized
209.article_body: The Nandini Layout Police have arrested three habitual offenders wanted in 14 cases of house break-ins and thefts in Bengaluru. A total of 1.12 kg of gold ornaments and 1.96 kg of silver articles worth ₹55.18 lakh have been seized from the accused, Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant said. Pant also announced a reward of ₹40,000 for the police team.

210.title: Oldest known ancestor of vampire squids, octopuses named after Biden
210.article_body: Researchers have identified the oldest known ancestor of vampyropods and named it after US President Joe Biden. 'Syllipsimopodi bideni' had 10 arms, fins, and rows of suckers to grasp prey. It lived 328 million years ago and represents a new species of vampyropods, the group of marine animals that includes vampire squids and octopuses.

211.title: Ukraine will never be a victory for Putin: US President Biden
211.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said the war in Ukraine would never be a victory for his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin. He said Putin may be able to take a city, but will never be able to hold the country. Biden announced a ban on US import of Russian oil, gas and energy in response to Moscow's invasion of Ukraine.

212.title: Mumbai to get its first air-conditioned unisex salon inside rail premises
212.article_body: Mumbai will get its first air-conditioned unisex salon-cum-spa corner inside rail premises at Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus. "This is certainly an interesting idea that we are exploring at CSMT and other stations as well. The one at CSMT is expected to be opened in 2-3 months," a CR official said. Facilities like massage, shaving, hair cutting will be provided here.

213.title: 5 students kidnap Class 12 boy over free passes for party in Gurugram
213.article_body: Police booked five students for allegedly kidnapping and assaulting a Class 12 boy after he refused them free passes for a party in Gurugram's Sector 29. Four suspects are students of Class 12 and one is a first-year student of law, police said. The accused met the victim at a mall and took him to a deserted place, police added.

214.title: Woman kills relative who assaulted her, semi-decomposed body found in Delhi
214.article_body: A 44-year-old woman, her son and his friend were arrested for allegedly thrashing her 35-year-old relative to death in Delhi. The man, Jaipal, was murdered after woman allegedly faced humiliation as he assaulted her, made video and sent it to her, her son and at least two relatives. Police said Jaipal's nude and semi decomposed body was found in flat.

215.title: Apple unveils Studio Display, Mac Studio starting from ₹1,59,900 & ₹1,89,900
215.article_body: Apple has launched a 27-inch Studio Display along with a Mac Studio featuring the new M1 Ultra and the M1 Max processor. The Studio Display sports a 5K Retina display, a 12-MP ultrawide camera, three USB-C ports and starts at ₹1,59,900. Apple's new display-less desktop computer, Mac Studio, includes USB-C ports and an SD card slot and starts at ₹1,89,900.

216.title: McDonald's temporarily shuts Russian restaurants, says 'can't ignore suffering in Ukraine'
216.article_body: McDonald's has announced it is temporarily closing all of its 850 restaurants in Russia, saying, "Our values mean we cannot ignore the needless human suffering unfolding in Ukraine." CEO Chris Kempczinski said the company will continue paying its 62,000 employees in Russia, adding, "At this juncture, it's impossible to predict when we might be able to reopen our restaurants."

217.title: Apple introduces 2 new colours for iPhone 13 lineup
217.article_body: Apple has announced two new colours for iPhone 13 Pro and iPhone 13, alpine green and green. "These new colours give customers even more options when choosing their iPhone, and we can't wait for them to take advantage of all the iPhone 13 lineup offers," said Bob Borchers, Apple's vice president of Worldwide Product Marketing.

218.title: Apple unveils iPad Air with M1 chip and 5G connectivity starting at ₹54,900
218.article_body: Apple today unveiled the new iPad Air with faster M1 processor starting at ₹54,900. The iPad Air comes with 5G connectivity, an upgraded 12MP front-facing camera with a wide angle lens, a faster USB-C port, and support for Apple's Smart Keyboard Folio and Magic Keyboard. It will be available in five colours with 64GB and 256GB storage options.

219.title: Apple launches new iPhone SE with 5G connectivity at a starting price of ₹43,900
219.article_body: Apple today announced the third-generation iPhone SE with 5G connectivity, a 4.7-inch Retina HD display, Touch ID and a single rear camera of 12 MP. Powered by Apple-designed A15 Bionic chip, it will be available in 64GB, 128GB and 256GB models in Midnight, Starlight and (Product) Red at a starting price of ₹43,900.

220.title: Help end sexual violence: Yami Gautam on International Women's Day
220.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam wrote an open letter on International Women's Day and made a "humble appeal" to "help end sexual violence". The 33-year-old, who was recently seen in the movie 'A Thursday' took to Instagram to share the letter. She said a character in the movie made her see the mental trauma, stigma and agony victims go through.

221.title: Tahira Kashyap celebrates Women's Day with her kids, shares video
221.article_body: Author-filmmaker Tahira Kashyap Khurrana celebrated Women's Day with her children, Virajveer Khurrana and Varushka Khurrana in London. She took to Instagram to share a video featuring pictures and clips with her children and wrote, "Celebrating this day, this life with my favs! They bring out the best in me." The trio reportedly reached London recently to meet Ayushmann Khurranna.

222.title: Didn’t deserve Filmfare award for Prem Aggan, says actor Fardeen Khan
222.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan in a recent interview said that he "definitely didn't" deserve the Filmfare Award for Best Debut Actor for his 1998 film 'Prem Aggan'. The 48-year-old further revealed that despite receiving the award, he got negative reviews for his performance. "The film didn't work...I had no work...films I'd signed before that, people took their money back," he added.

223.title: Everyday is women's day: Kareena Kapoor Khan pens note on Instagram
223.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan on the occasion of International Women's Day, penned an inspiring note on social media to share with her fans. She took to Instagram and wrote, "Every day is women's day...Pride, love, equality, respect." She also shared a collage with pictures of Soha Ali Khan, Sharmila Tagore and Saba Pataudi which read, "Proud to be a woman."

224.title: No longer insisting on NATO membership, says Ukraine
224.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said he's no longer pressing for NATO membership for Ukraine, an issue that was one of Russia's stated reasons for invasion. "I've cooled down regarding this question a long time ago after we understood NATO isn't prepared to accept Ukraine," he stated. "The alliance is afraid of controversial things, and confrontation with Russia," the President added.

225.title: How does the World Test Championship points table read after 1st Pakistan-Australia Test?
225.article_body: After the first Pakistan-Australia Test ended in a draw, Australia are on top of the World Test Championship (WTC) points table with 77.77% of points won. Pakistan are second on the points table with 66.66% of points won. England are last on the table with 9.25% of points won, while India are fifth with 54.16% of points won.

226.title: PL suspends agreement with Russian broadcast partner over Ukraine war
226.article_body: Premier League on Tuesday suspended its agreement with Russian broadcast partner Okko Sport over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Premier League said that it had unanimously agreed the suspension with all 20 Premier League clubs. The league added it will donate £1 million to the Disasters Emergency Committee "to deliver humanitarian aid directly to those in need".

227.title: Queen Elizabeth meets Trudeau in 1st meeting since getting COVID-19
227.article_body: Queen Elizabeth on Monday met Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau in her first official in-person meeting since testing positive for COVID-19 on February 20. The queen suffered mild cold-like symptoms at the time, cancelling several meetings while continuing to carry out light duties. Trudeau is in Britain to talk with Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

228.title: Don't agree with exit polls, they create mental pressure: RLD chief
228.article_body: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) president Jayant Chaudhary on Tuesday said that he doesn't agree with the view presented by exit polls and that they create mental pressure. "There is a process for exit polls. No exit poll person was seen at the polling booths. I do not know from where they got the data," he said.

229.title: Defending freedom is going to cost Americans: Biden as US bans Russian oil imports
229.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday, while banning imports of Russian oil, called the move a "powerful blow" to "Putin's war". He further said that "defending freedom is going to cost". "It's going to cost us as well in the United States. Republicans and Democrats understand that alike. Republicans and Democrats alike are clear we must do this," Biden stated.

230.title: West Bengal cabinet gets new finance minister after reallocation
230.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee effected a minor reallocation in the cabinet and gave Chandrima Bhattacharya independent charge of the finance department with the rank of minister of state. Calling the elevation the best gift for state's women on Women's Day, Bhattacharya said, "I...will carry out the responsibilities entrusted to me till my last breath."

231.title: Majithia's judicial custody in drug case extended till March 22
231.article_body: Mohali District Court on Tuesday extended Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) leader Bikram Singh Majithia's judicial custody in a drug smuggling probe till March 22. He had been earlier remanded to judicial custody till March 8 after being booked under relevant sections of Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act in December. Majithia contested Punjab Assembly polls from Amritsar East seat.

232.title: 2 arrested over Srinagar grenade attack which killed 2, injured many
232.article_body: Two people have been arrested in connection with a grenade attack in J&K's Srinagar, which killed two and injured over 35 people. The Special Investigation Team (SIT) was able to identify the two accused and they were named as Mohammad Bariq and Fazil Nabi Sofi. Police said the accused committed the attack on direction of active terrorists in Kashmir Valley.

233.title: Romania to lift all COVID-19 restrictions from March 9
233.article_body: Romania's Health Minister Alexandru Rafila on Tuesday said the country will lift all COVID-19 restrictions from March 9, including an obligation to wear masks both indoors and outdoors. Romania is the European Union's second-least vaccinated country with under 42% of the population fully vaccinated. Measures like capacity limits on restaurants and events along with curfews on shops will be lifted.

234.title: Navalny urges Russians to protest Putin's 'hideous war' in Ukraine
234.article_body: Jailed Kremlin critic Alexei Navalny has urged Russians to oppose Vladimir Putin's "hideous war that he has waged against Ukraine". Navalny said, "The...anti-war protests should not be halted under any circumstances." Reportedly, more than 13,500 citizens across Russia have so far been detained since February 24 for protesting against the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

235.title: 31-year-old woman loses palm while segregating garbage in Pune
235.article_body: A woman lost her palm while segregating garbage at a residential society in Pune. Laxmi Shinde, who is a mother of three children, said, "Even today when the world is celebrating women's day, I and my family have no reason to celebrate." The 31-year-old further said that she and her family "hardly have any money" to keep themselves going.

236.title: Man held in Guj for cheating a man on pretext of online share trading
236.article_body: A man has been arrested from Gujarat for allegedly cheating a person of ₹7 lakh on the pretext of investing the amount in the online share market. A police official said the accused, 51-year-old Ramabhai Patel, allegedly cheated Himanshu Sharma, from MP's Jabalpur, by luring him with investment in the share market and opening a demat account for online trading.

237.title: Bride protests outside groom's Raj home as he doesn't show up at wedding
237.article_body: A bride in Rajasthan's Bharatpur district staged a dharna outside the groom's home after he didn't show up at their wedding scheduled on March 4. The groom's father has been arrested on the basis of a complaint filed by her father. The groom, who is in the Army, is admitted to a military hospital in Mathura, police said.

238.title: Seeing irresponsible comments on Indian envoy's death, treat it with decency: Govt
238.article_body: After India's envoy to Palestine Mukul Arya was found dead inside the embassy in Ramallah, the External Affairs Ministry said, "We've seen some irresponsible comments on passing away of Mukul Arya...He died of natural causes." The MEA further urged the "young diplomat be treated with decency and respect". This comes after AAP's Sanjay Singh claimed Arya died in "suspicious condition".

239.title: Ranveer & I talk about how staying grounded is important: Deepika
239.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has said that staying grounded is the most important thing for her. "Ranveer [Singh] and I talk about this often...how anyone can be successful, but what matters more is to be remembered as a good human being," Deepika stated. Deepika added simple things like waking up next to her husband, having breakfast with family make her happy.

240.title: It almost felt surreal to travel after two years: Rasika Dugal
240.article_body: Actress Rasika Dugal has said that she felt surreal to travel outside India after two years for the shooting of her upcoming film 'Lord Curzon Ki Haveli'. Rasika stated that she was initially nervous because of COVID-19. "But once we were there and everyone in the unit had tested negative, I was so much more relaxed," she added.

241.title: Latvian politician joins forces in Ukraine to fight against Russia
241.article_body: Latvian politician Juris Jurašs has joined the fight against Russia in Ukraine, his party confirmed on Tuesday. It was Jurašs' "personal decision" to fight alongside Ukrainian soldiers, Latvian Justice Minister Jānis Bordāns said without revealing more information citing safety concerns. Last week, the Ukrainian President said that around 16,000 foreigners had volunteered to fight for Ukraine.

242.title: He helped me a lot: Alexander Zverev on 'role model' Roger Federer
242.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev said former world number one and 20-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer was a "role model" for him when he was younger and was starting out on the ATP Tour. "We had a lot of conversations at a younger age and I think he helped me a lot in that regard," he said.

243.title: He is a worker, a fighter & has a great mentality: Paula Badosa on Nadal
243.article_body: World number seven Paula Badosa said Rafael Nadal is "a worker, a fighter and has a great mentality". Nadal won his 21st Grand Slam title at the Australian Open in January. "He has always been an example that I have looked at when I have faced difficult moments and if I want to emulate someone, it is Nadal," Badosa said.

244.title: US bans Russian oil imports over Ukraine war
244.article_body: US President Joe Biden has decided to ban Russian oil imports, he said during a live address as he announced actions to continue to hold Russia accountable over invasion of Ukraine. "We're banning all imports of Russian oil and gas and energy. That means Russian oil will no longer be accepted at US ports," he stated.

245.title: Mbappe doubtful for PSG's UCL game against Real Madrid, Ramos ruled out
245.article_body: Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) on Monday said Kylian Mbappe is doubtful for their Champions League Round of 16 second-leg tie against Real Madrid on Wednesday, while former Real Madrid defender Sergio Ramos has been ruled out. PSG said Mbappe sustained a knock on his right foot during training, with a further medical update to be given in the next 24 hours.

246.title: Australia's Labuschagne shares posters made by Pakistani fans, says 'Great to see'
246.article_body: Australia batter Marnus Labuschagne took to Instagram to share pictures of posters made by Pakistani fans for the first Test between Australia and Pakistan. "It's been great to see all the signs in the crowd at Rawalpindi feeling very welcome," he wrote. One of the posters read, "Hey Marnus! How do I pronounce your last name?"

247.title: My son's good looks can't guarantee his success in B'wood: Bobby Deol
247.article_body: Actor Bobby Deol has said that his son Aryaman Deol's good looks cannot guarantee his success in Bollywood. "His good looks are a plus point...but there's no guarantee about what's gonna happen in this industry," Bobby said. He cited his example and said, "People used to say the same things to me...But I know the reality."

248.title: Former world no. 3 Dominic Thiem pulls out of Indian Wells, Miami
248.article_body: Former world number three Dominic Thiem on Monday said he was pulling out of the ATP Masters 1000 events in Indian Wells and Miami due to a wrist injury. Thiem suffered a wrist injury in the Mallorca Open in 2021 and has not played since. Thiem added he hopes to return when the clay court season begins in April.

249.title: Police recover 22 pressure bombs, 16 grenades, weapons in Assam
249.article_body: The police have recovered 22 pressure bombs along with 22 detonator caps, 16 HE36 grenades, two UZI rifles with four magazines and one silencer from Mahamaya and Guma reserve forest areas in Assam. The weapons were hidden underground and police suspect that the recovered weapons belong to the former National Democratic Front of Bodoland (NDFB) militants.

250.title: Shaktimaan has all kinds of powers, can do everything: Mukesh Khanna
250.article_body: Actor Mukesh Khanna has said, "If you compare with the powers of any superhero, maybe Iron Man, Spider-Man or Superman...Shaktimaan can do everything." He added that 'Shaktimaan' has all kinds of powers because he's made from five elements of the universe. Mukesh Khanna added that the upcoming film 'Shaktimaan' will be a trilogy.

251.title: Kane scores 176th PL goal, overtakes Henry in all-time PL scoring list
251.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur's Harry Kane on Monday scored his 176th Premier League goal, overtaking former Arsenal striker Thierry Henry's tally of 175. Kane is now sixth on the all-time Premier League scoring list. "Thierry was one of the greatest strikers we have seen, so it's nice to go above him in the scorers list and hopefully they keep coming," Kane said.

252.title: Toothbrush pierces woman's cheek & gets stuck after she falls, removed post surgery in TN
252.article_body: A 34-year-old Tamil Nadu woman had to go through surgery after a plastic toothbrush was stuck inside her cheek when she slipped and fell in her bathroom while brushing. Ekamai Revathi fell sideways, which led to the brush piercing through her cheek. It was stuck in a manner that she couldn't open or close her mouth or scream for help.

253.title: Western nations didn’t save our cities, although they can: Ukraine Prez
253.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has blamed the West for not saving Ukraine's cities and civilians from Russian bombs, although they can. He said, "While Russians are to blame for...killings, responsibility is shared by those who for 13 days in their Western offices haven't been able to approve...necessary decision." He has demanded Western powers to enforce a no-fly zone over Ukraine.

254.title: 5 teens rape 2 minor girls in Bihar after watching porn on phone
254.article_body: 5 teenage boys allegedly gang-raped 2 minor girls on Monday evening in Barbigha police station area in Bihar, police said on Tuesday. The survivor's family caught two of the accused and handed them over to the police. During the investigation, the boys allegedly admitted that they committed the crime after watching porn videos on a smartphone.

255.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal honours transgender activist Gauri Sawant
255.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday honoured Gauri Sawant, a transgender activist from Mumbai who has been helping transgender people. Sawant's petition in the Supreme Court helped in the recognition of transgender as the third gender. Kejriwal also lauded the Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) for instilling a sense of security among women in the national capital.

256.title: DCW has instilled sense of security among women of Delhi: Kejriwal
256.article_body: Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday hailed the Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) for its work, saying it has instilled a sense of security among women in the capital. While speaking at the International Women's Day Awards function hosted by the DCW, Kejriwal said that the women know they can contact 181 (DCW helpline) if they face any injustice.

257.title: Paraglider loses balance in Himachal, tourist & helper killed
257.article_body: A tourist and a helper died, while a pilot was injured in a paragliding accident in Himachal Pradesh's Bir Billing, ANI reported. The incident took place when the helper who pushes the paraglider for take-off got tangled and was launched into the air along with them. Due to this, the paraglider lost balance.

258.title: Video shows Russian tank blowing up civilian car, killing elderly couple in Ukraine
258.article_body: A video has surfaced online, allegedly showing a Russian tank blowing up a civilian car and killing an elderly couple in Ukraine. The video shows the car coming to a stop before the tank fired at it. Another video of the incident shows the elderly man's body in the driver's seat, with the elderly woman's head resting on his shoulder.

259.title: Seize opportunity to export best quality wheat: PM Modi amid war
259.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine has increased the demand for India's wheat globally and this opportunity should be seized to export the best quality product. He said that the financial sector, import-export departments and shipping industry should make a "comprehensive effort" to help wheat and other exporters.

260.title: Haryana budget is a 'jugglery of words': Former CM Hooda
260.article_body: Former Haryana Chief Minister Bhupinder Singh Hooda on Tuesday described the budget presented by the BJP-led government as a "jugglery of words". Hooda further said that the government has cut economic progress and infrastructure budget by 3% even at a time of record unemployment. Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar presented the budget estimates for 2022-23 on Tuesday.

261.title: Former Ukrainian Prez Yanukovych tells Zelenskyy to 'stop the war'
261.article_body: Amid Russia-Ukraine tensions, ex-Ukrainian President Viktor Yanukovych has urged President Volodymyr Zelenskyy to "stop the war". Yanukovych, who's in exile in Russia since being ousted from power in 2014, has said that Zelenskyy should reach a peaceful consensus on the conflict. Notably, Ukrainian media recently reported that Russia wants to reinstate Yanukovych as Ukraine's leader after the war.

262.title: SC declines to hear plea seeking VVPAT verification before counting
262.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday refused to urgently hear a plea seeking the verification of Voter Verified Paper Audit Trail (VVPAT) of Electronic Voting Machines (EVMs) before the counting of votes. "Let counting go on as per established practice," SC said. It said it would list the matter before an appropriate bench after counting is finished for Assembly polls.

263.title: Let's dedicate ACM Awards 2022 to people in Ukraine: Dolly Parton
263.article_body: Amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict, singer Dolly Parton voiced her support for the people in Ukraine while hosting the 57th Academy of Country Music Awards (ACM Awards 2022). "I want us to send our love and hope to our brothers and sisters in Ukraine," she said. She added, "Let's dedicate this whole show to them and pray for peace around this...world."

264.title: There's no alternative to PM Modi: WB BJP chief to Mamata Banerjee
264.article_body: West Bengal BJP chief Sukanta Majumdar on Tuesday said there's no alternative to PM Modi after CM Mamata Banerjee claimed that BJP will be ousted from power once people find a viable alternative. "Such a big target isn't good for [TMC's] health," Majumdar said. Earlier, Banerjee called BJP a "dangabaaz (rioter) and corrupt party" that wants to "destroy democracy".

265.title: Trained exactly like male colleagues: India's 1st female Rafale pilot
265.article_body: India's first female Rafale fighter pilot Flight Lieutenant Shivangi Singh said, "I've been trained exactly like my male colleagues". Speaking on the occasion of International Women's Day, Singh added, "The machine doesn't recognize gender, it acts as per the inputs given to it." She said the experience of becoming a fighter pilot has been thrilling and satisfying.

266.title: Resign in 24 hours: Pak Opposition to PM Imran Khan over poor governance
266.article_body: Pakistan's Opposition parties have moved a no-confidence motion seeking the ouster of PM Imran Khan and accused him of mismanaging the economy and poor governance. "Resign in 24 hours...face us in...election," Pakistan Peoples Party leader Bilawal Bhutto said during a rally. Meanwhile, Imran Khan vowed to fight any move to unseat him, saying, "Whatever they do, I'm ready for that."

267.title: 3 LeT terrorists arrested in J&K's Pulwama, grenade recovered
267.article_body: Three terrorists associated with the Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) have been arrested in J&K's Pulwama. Local police, along with 55 RR (Rashtriya Rifles) and 182 battalion of the CRPF, also recovered a grenade, 13 rounds of AK-47 and some incriminating material from their possession following the arrests. A senior police official said that the trio were terrorist Arif Hazar's associates.

268.title: Use own weapons in future wars: Indian Army chief on 'lesson' from Russia-Ukraine war
268.article_body: Speaking about the lessons India learnt from Russia-Ukraine war, Chief of the Army Staff MM Naravane said, "Biggest lesson is we've to be ready to fight future wars with indigenous weapons." "Steps towards Aatmanirbhar Bharat in defence have to be taken more urgently. Wars of future should be fought with own weapon systems," he added.

269.title: Man rapes & kills 9-yr-old after luring her with snacks in Aligarh
269.article_body: A man allegedly raped and murdered a nine-year-old girl after luring her with snacks in Uttar Pradesh's Aligarh. The victim was reportedly bludgeoned to death with a brick by the accused, who was reportedly her uncle. Police arrested the man and said that he is a drug addict and was found in a semi-conscious state.

270.title: Ukraine running short of vital medical supplies amid war: WHO
270.article_body: The World Health Organization said on Tuesday that attacks on hospitals, ambulances and other health care facilities in Ukraine have increased rapidly, adding that nine people had died in 16 attacks on health care facilities since the start of a Russian invasion of Ukraine. The WHO further said the war-hit Ukraine is running short of vital medical supplies, including oxygen.

271.title: Suspended BJP leader Jay Prakash Majumdar joins TMC
271.article_body: Suspended BJP leader Jay Prakash Majumdar joined Trinamool Congress (TMC) on Tuesday in the presence of party supremo and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee. He was also appointed as TMC's state Vice President. Majumdar, along with BJP leader Ritesh Tiwari, had been issued show-cause notices by BJP in January for alleged anti-party activities and were later suspended.

272.title: Actor dies fighting Russia in Ukraine; his last Instagram post shows him in army uniform
272.article_body: Ukrainian actor Pasha Lee, who decided to defend the country by joining the Territorial Defence Forces of the Armed Forces of Ukraine amid Russian invasion, has been killed in Russian shelling. In his last post a few days ago, the 33-year-old shared a picture of himself in a military uniform and wrote, "We are smiling because we will manage."

273.title: Man tied up with his pants down after he's caught stealing in Ukraine amid war
273.article_body: A man who was allegedly caught looting in Kyiv during Russian attacks on the city was tied to a lamp post with his pants down as punishment. He was pictured standing near a petrol station in Ukraine's capital, unable to move after being caught by locals. There have been reports of looting in areas across Ukraine since the invasion began.

274.title: A tragedy we will never come to terms with: Shane Warne's parents on his demise
274.article_body: Releasing a statement following the death of Shane Warne, the Australian cricket legend's parents Keith and Brigitte said that his demise is a tragedy they will never come to terms with. "Looking to a future without Shane is inconceivable, hopefully the mountain of happy memories we all have will help us cope with our ongoing grief," they added.

275.title: EVMs stolen in Varanasi, SP workers stopped truck: Akhilesh as video surfaces
275.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday alleged that EVMs are being stolen in Varanasi. He also claimed that SP workers intercepted a truck full of EVMs, a video of which has surfaced. "We need to be alert if EVMs are being transported," he added. Meanwhile, Varanasi DM Kaushal Raj Sharma claimed these EVMs were being used for training.

276.title: India promoting greater roles for girls in armed forces: PM Modi
276.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on International Women's Day said the country is promoting greater roles for girls in the armed forces and now the admission of girls has started in Sainik Schools. He was virtually addressing a seminar in Gujarat's Kutch. "Today the priority of the country lies in the full participation of women in India's development journey," he added.

277.title: 4 security personnel killed, 20 others injured in blast in Pakistan
277.article_body: Four security personnel were killed and over 20 were injured in a blast in Pakistan's Balochistan, according to police. The blast occurred in Balochistan's Sibi district, where the annual Sibi mela was being held. "It took place after Pakistan President Arif Alvi attended the festival in Sibi," Hafeez Rind, a senior official of Counter-Terrorism Department Sibi was quoted as saying.

278.title: When you're passionate about your craft, you want to reinvent: Divya
278.article_body: Actress Divya Dutta said she's being offered roles that she had never portrayed before. Divya added people wanted to do glamorous roles in earlier times, however, they are now opting for story-oriented roles. "The range of roles being offered have become bigger and better," she stated. Divya added, "When you are passionate about your craft, you always want to reinvent."

279.title: US CDC urges citizens to avoid travel to NZ, Hong Kong & Thailand
279.article_body: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) on Monday urged citizens to avoid travel to New Zealand, Hong Kong and Thailand due to rising COVID-19 cases. The CDC updated its travel recommendation for all three countries to its highest level, "Level Four: Very High". India is currently on the CDC's third level, "Level Three: High".

280.title: Our goal is to forge a non-BJP front in Goa: Cong's Chidambaram
280.article_body: Congress leader P Chidambaram said Congress is open to an alliance with anti-BJP parties and that talks regarding the same have begun. "Our goal is to forge a non-BJP front and such efforts are going on in other parts of India," he said. This comes a day after a majority of the exit polls predicted a hung assembly in Goa.

281.title: We'll punish everyone who committed atrocities in war: Ukraine Prez
281.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has warned that the country will "not forgive or forget the premeditated murder" being carried out by Russian President Vladimir Putin and his forces. He said, "We will not forgive. We will not forget. We will punish everyone who committed atrocities in this war." "[Instead] of forgiveness there will be a day of judgment," he added.

282.title: Global COVID-19 death toll passes 6 million mark: Reports
282.article_body: The global COVID-19 death toll on Monday passed 6 million as per data collected by Johns Hopkins University in the US. The last one million COVID-19 deaths reportedly occurred in the past four months. Due to poor record-keeping and testing in several parts of the world, many experts believe the six million figure is lower than the actual death count.

283.title: Porn content on social media responsible for rape of minor girls: Raj minister
283.article_body: Rajasthan minister Shanti Kumar Dhariwal on Tuesday blamed pornographic content available on social media for rape of minor girls. "Inhuman tendency is being developed among youth and obscene content on social media is the main reason for this. This content is...served in an unrestricted manner," he said. Rajasthan recorded 5,793 cases of rape of minor girls in last three years.

284.title: Cong to move its candidates to resort before Goa poll result: Reports
284.article_body: Ahead of the Goa Assembly poll result on March 10 (Thursday), all Congress candidates will be staying in a resort in North Goa on Wednesday, reports said. The Congress candidates will be heading towards the counting stations from the resort, as per the reports. This comes after exit polls predicted a hung Assembly in Goa.

285.title: Will support Poland if it decides to send jets to Ukraine: UK
285.article_body: UK Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Tuesday said Britain would support Poland if it decided to send fighter jets to Ukraine. "I would support the Poles and whatever choice they make," he said. Wallace added Britain would not be able to offer Ukraine any aircraft. "We would protect Poland, we'll help them with anything that they need," he said.

286.title: All Indian students moved out of Ukraine's Sumy: Govt as it shares video
286.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi on Tuesday tweeted, "Happy to inform that we have been able to move out all Indian students from Sumy. They are currently en route to Poltava, from where they will board trains to western Ukraine." Sharing a video of students, Bagchi added that Operation Ganga flights are being prepared to bring them home.

287.title: BJP's exit from UP is certain: Tejashwi Yadav ahead of poll results
287.article_body: Reacting to exit polls on UP Assembly elections, Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tejashwi Yadav has said that the BJP's departure from UP is certain. "The anger we have seen amongst the people for the [UP] government clearly gives the message that [BJP] is not going to win and Akhilesh Ji will form the government," Yadav added.

288.title: Child dies of dehydration in Ukraine's city after days without water or power
288.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Tuesday a child had died from dehydration in Ukraine's besieged city of Mariupol, which has had no water, power or heating supplies for days. "In 2022, from dehydration," Zelenskyy said in a video address, likening the crisis linked to Russian bombardment of Ukrainian cities to that created by Nazi invasion during World War Two.

289.title: Nearly 18,000 Indians brought back from Ukraine since Feb 22: Govt
289.article_body: The Ministry of Civil Aviation informed on Tuesday that nearly 18,000 Indians have been repatriated from war-hit Ukraine since February 22. "The number of Indians airlifted by 75 special civilian flights goes up to 15,521. IAF had flown 12 missions to bring back 2,467 passengers, as part of the Operation Ganga," it added. Twenty-eight flights were operated from Budapest.

290.title: Mumbai Police probing extortion charges against 4 ED officers: Raut
290.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut has said the Mumbai Police were investigating extortion charges against four Enforcement Directorate officers, adding that "some of them will go to jail". He said, "ED and some of its officials have become...ATM for...BJP." His remarks come on a day when Income Tax department conducted raids on premises linked to Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray's aide.

291.title: TMC could've done better if we had more time: Mamata on Goa polls
291.article_body: Ahead of Goa Assembly poll results, Trinamool Congress (TMC) supremo Mamata Banerjee said on Tuesday that party could've done better if it had more time. "I'm happy that we were able to reach out to every family in Goa with our logo [but]...We...started late," she added. TMC had previously said it's open to post-poll alliance with like-minded parties in Goa.

292.title: Ukraine war may have limited impact on domestic credit market: Report
292.article_body: An India Ratings and Research (IRR) report said Russia-Ukraine war's impact on the domestic credit market may be limited as the banking system has adequate liquidity. The duration and intensity of the war will be the key determinant for the macro and micro risks. Entities with a weak financial profile may face financing challenges if the situation worsens, it added.

293.title: Fire breaks out at Delhi plastic factory, 100 firefighters deployed
293.article_body: A fire broke out at a plastic factory in Delhi's Bawana area on Tuesday morning. According to officials, the fire broke out at 6:30 am when 50 workers were present inside. Delhi Fire Service said they deployed 25 fire tenders and 100 firefighters to the spot. Officials said they also used a drone in the firefighting operation.

294.title: House of suspect raided by NIA in Pune's Kondhwa over ISKP case
294.article_body: A suspect's house was raided by the NIA in connection with a case of planning terrorist attacks in India. Officials said searches were conducted at 38-year-old Talha Khan's residence in Kondhwa, Pune, on Monday over propagating terrorist group ISIS' ideology as part of outlawed Islamic State Khorasan Province (ISKP) activities. Various incriminating documents and digital devices were seized.

295.title: My life is guided by women: Shahid on mother Neliima and wife Mira
295.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, actor Shahid Kapoor took to Instagram and posted a picture of his mother Neliima Azeem and wife Mira Kapoor. "These two are enough for me to know how much...my life is guided, supported...by women," Shahid captioned his post. "Here's to every woman...You all make this world a much better place," he added.

296.title: CBFC passes 'The Kashmir Files' with 7 cuts & 'A' certificate
296.article_body: The Central Board of Film Certification (CBFC) passed 'The Kashmir Files' with an 'A' certificate. The film, directed by Vivek Agnihotri, was approved by the board with seven cuts and words like 'Hindu' and 'Pandit' were removed when they were associated with cuss words. The board even changed the name of the university from JNU to ANU in the film.

297.title: Trafficked woman reunited with family in Arunachal after 12 years
297.article_body: A trafficked woman was reunited with her biological family in Arunachal Pradesh after 12 years on March 7. Arunachal Women Helpline (WHL-181), which had received information about a survivor of child trafficking and domestic violence, facilitated her return. According to the woman's statement, she was just eight years old when her stepmother sold her to a person in Assam.

298.title: Haryana announces ₹5 lakh award named after Sushma Swaraj
298.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on the occasion of the International Women's Day on Tuesday announced an award named after late BJP leader Sushma Swaraj. A sum of ₹5 lakh will be given to women from Haryana who have made significant contributions. He also announced Haryana Matrushakti Udyamita Scheme to support women in becoming entrepreneurs.

299.title: Scindia carries small girl to her mother in evacuation flight, helps them with seats
299.article_body: Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia, who was in Romania to expedite evacuation of Indian nationals through Operation Ganga, was seen helping an Indian family with their seats in a flight. A video shows Scindia carrying a small girl to where her mother was seated in the flight after asking a passenger to swap her seat with that of the girl.

300.title: Google to buy cybersecurity firm Mandiant for $5.4 billion
300.article_body: Google on Tuesday said it would buy cybersecurity firm Mandiant at $23/share in an all-cash deal for approximately $5.4 billion. Google's offer represents a premium of about 57% to Mandiant's stock price before a report said Microsoft was planning to buy the firm. "Google Cloud shares our mission-driven culture to bring security to every organization,” said Mandiant CEO Kevin Mandia.

301.title: 2 held in Delhi for credit card fraud; 17 sim cards, 2 laptops found
301.article_body: Two persons were arrested in Delhi's Najafgarh area for allegedly cheating people in the guise of redemption of credit card points, the police said. According to the complainant, his credit card was used for three transactions worth ₹44,000 and the money was transferred to a wallet and a shopping website. Police recovered seven mobile phones, 17 SIM cards, two laptops.

302.title: Fake claims of Russia-Ukraine war being a hoax go viral
302.article_body: Theories claiming the Russia-Ukraine war is a hoax have gone viral. Some social media users claimed actors are being used to act out scenes from an attack. One such claim is in the form of a video, which shows people getting fake blood applied. The video, however, shows the preparation of a scene for Ukrainian TV series 'Contamin' in 2020.

303.title: 2 13-yr-old students beaten outside Delhi school by group of boys
303.article_body: Two 13-year-old students were allegedly beaten by a group of boys outside their school on February 28 in the Delhi Cantonment area, the police said. The boys are students of Kendriya Vidyalaya No. 2 and were returning home when the incident took place. One student sustained injuries on his head and had to get stitches, the boy's father said.

304.title: Navi Mumbai policeman goes missing after alleging senior of harassment
304.article_body: Manesh Bachhav, a Navi Mumbai police sub-inspector, has been missing since Saturday afternoon. Bachhav alleged a "corrupt" senior police inspector of harassing him and causing mental trauma, according to a letter he wrote to Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray and DGP Rajnish Seth. Police started an inquiry into the allegations levelled by Bachhav after his letter went viral on social media.

305.title: Delhi HC refuses to stay AAP govt's order banning discounts on liquor
305.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday refused to stay the AAP government's decision to ban discounts on liquor. Several liquor licence holders had complained against the order, saying that the rules of the game can't be changed after the game has begun. Today, Justice V Kameswar Rao said, "I am dismissing the applications...A detailed order will be uploaded."

306.title: 33% of govt jobs in Tripura will be reserved for women: Amit Shah
306.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on the occasion of International Women's Day said that 33% of government jobs in Tripura would be reserved for women. He said that for the youth of Tripura, BJP will establish a National Forensic Science University. Shah said this while addressing a rally on the completion of four years of the BJP government in Tripura.

307.title: CNG prices hiked in Delhi-NCR by up to ₹1, to cost ₹57.51/kg in Delhi
307.article_body: CNG prices have been increased in Delhi-NCR by up to ₹1 per kg with effect from Tuesday. In Delhi, one kg CNG will now be costlier by 50 paise and cost ₹57.51 from earlier ₹57.01. The prices in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad have been hiked by ₹1 per kg and CNG in these cities will cost ₹59.58 per kg.

308.title: Leave using any means of transport: Embassy to Indians in Ukraine
308.article_body: The Indian Embassy in Ukraine on Tuesday urged its nationals to use the humanitarian corridor, created for evacuation, and leave using any means of transport available while considering their safety. "The...corridor...has been announced...from 1000 hrs on March 8," it said. The embassy added that given the current situation, the creation of the next humanitarian corridor is uncertain.

309.title: Inspector Madhulatha appointed as 1st woman SHO in Hyd
309.article_body: Inspector K Madhulatha was appointed as Hyderabad's first woman Station House Officer (SHO) on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. Hyderabad also got its first woman officer to lead a law-and-order (L&O) police station in its 175-year-old history. She took charge as SHO of Lallaguda police station in the presence of Home Minister Mohammed Mahmood Ali.

310.title: Ukraine conflict could lead to 3rd world war: Venezuelan Prez Maduro
310.article_body: The military conflict in Ukraine could lead to a third world war, Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro has said. "[The conflict] has global consequences, such as a devastating impact on...prices of oil, petrol and gas, on...cost of food," Maduro added. Notably, President Maduro had expressed "strong support" for Russia and condemned "destabilising actions" of the West following Ukraine's invasion.

311.title: Pub in UK installs Putin's photo in its toilets, shares pic
311.article_body: A UK pub has installed a photograph of Russian President Vladimir Putin in its toilets to take a stand against invasion of Ukraine. The photo space in the urinals of Raglan Road Irish Bar was previously occupied by former US President Donald Trump. The bar posted a photo on their Instagram account captioned, "Vladimir Putin in the men's loo."

312.title: Natasha and I lost twins in sixth month of pregnancy: Fardeen Khan
312.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan has said that his wife Natasha Madhwani suffered a lot because of IVF and added, "It's very hard on your body and your health." He further revealed that he and his wife lost twins in the sixth month of pregnancy. "It was a tough time. She did a live birth, and we lost the babies," he stated.

313.title: 52 Indian sailors stranded in Mykolaiv Port in Ukraine evacuated
313.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine on Tuesday said it intervened in the evacuation of 75 Indian sailors who were stranded in Mykolaiv Port and evacuated 52 of them on Monday. Route constraints precluded the evacuation of the remaining 23 sailors and it is attempting their evacuation on Tuesday, it added. The embassy also evacuated two Lebanese and three Syrian sailors.

314.title: Malaysia to reopen its borders from April 1 with quarantine waiver
314.article_body: Malaysia is set to fully reopen its borders from April 1 and allow quarantine-free entry to vaccinated visitors, PM Ismail Sabri Yaakob said on Tuesday. Visitors will, however, need to take an RT-PCR test two days before departure and a rapid antigen test after arrival in the country. Additionally, Malaysian nationals will be able to resume international travel.

315.title: India to resume regular international flights from March 27 after 2 years
315.article_body: The Centre has decided to resume scheduled commercial international passenger flights to and from India from March 27 after two years. "International operations shall be subject to strict adherence to Ministry of Health guidelines for international travel," the Civil Aviation Ministry said on Tuesday. The restrictions were in place due to coronavirus pandemic.

316.title: 2 million people have fled Ukraine since start of Russian invasion: UN
316.article_body: The UN High Commissioner for Refugees (UNHCR) Filippo Grandi on Tuesday said that two million people have fled Ukraine since Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24. It represents the fastest-growing refugee crisis in Europe since World War II. Grandi warned that a second wave of refugees from Ukraine is likely to be more vulnerable than the first wave.

317.title: Australia-Pakistan score 1,187 runs for 14 wickets, use 16 bowlers as Test ends in a draw
317.article_body: Australia and Pakistan aggregated 1,187 runs in the first Test in Rawalpindi which witnessed 16 bowlers being used across the five days. The match witnessed four hundreds and four fifties, with Pakistan opener Imam-ul-Haq slamming two hundreds in the match. The match was Australia's first in Pakistan after 24 years.

318.title: Norway wealth fund puts Adani Ports, 2 others on its watch list
318.article_body: Norway's sovereign wealth fund has put Adani Ports, Canada's Bombardier and South Korea's Hyundai Glovis on its watch list for possible exclusion from investment due to ethical concerns. It said Adani Ports has been put on the watch list for its possible contribution to "serious violations" of human rights because of its involvement in building a port terminal in Myanmar.

319.title: Working hours of Mumbai women police personnel reduced to 8 hours
319.article_body: On the occasion of International Women's Day, the newly-appointed Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey has ordered that women police personnel will be getting eight-hour shifts from Tuesday. The officials reportedly said the new shorter duty time for women personnel will be in force till further orders. The directive aims to help women personnel maintain a healthy work-home balance, they said.

320.title: Putin is a spent force in the world: UK Defence Secretary
320.article_body: British Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said that Russian President Vladimir Putin is "a spent force in the world" whatever happens in Ukraine. "This will be Putin's end," Wallace added. "No one will be taking his phone calls in the long term. He has exhausted his army...He's reducing his economy to zero...he has to take responsibility for that," Wallace further said.

321.title: Zelenskyy recalls Ukrainian peacekeepers from UN missions to fight Russia
321.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has signed a decree recalling Ukrainian peacekeepers, along with their weapons and hardware, participating in UN missions to assist in the war effort. The move is aimed at strengthening Ukrainian Army against Russian aggression, Deputy Head of Ukrainian President's Office Andrii Sybiha said, publishing the order. Russia began invading Ukraine on February 24.

322.title: Fire breaks out at scrap godown in Thane, no injuries reported
322.article_body: Fire department officials confirmed that a fire broke out at a scrap godown located near the HP petrol pump on the Shilphata-Mahape road in Maharashtra's Thane on Tuesday. While no casualties or injuries have been reported so far, fire tenders were immediately rushed to the spot to control the fire.

323.title: Shell to stop buying oil, gas from Russia, apologises for buying cargo after invasion
323.article_body: British oil giant Shell has announced that it will stop purchasing Russian oil and gas, with CEO Ben van Beurden apologising for buying a cargo of Russian crude oil after Ukraine invasion. "As an immediate first step, we will stop all spot purchases of Russian crude oil, shut service stations, aviation fuels and lubricants operations in Russia," Shell said.

324.title: All sanction options against Russia being considered: Netherlands
324.article_body: Netherlands Foreign Minister Wopke Hoekstra said on Tuesday that all sanction options against Russia are under consideration, including those on Russian energy. Hoekstra added, however, all EU nations should be able to "bear the burden" if they're imposed. EU buys 45% of its gas, around one-third of its oil and nearly half of its coal from Russia, Reuters reported.

325.title: Ashwin is much more difficult to face than Harbhajan: Gautam Gambhir
325.article_body: Sharing his opinion on the off-spinner who is more difficult to face between Ravichandran Ashwin and Harbhajan Singh, Gautam Gambhir named Ashwin as he is "far more" accurate and tough because of his speed variations. "As a batter, I would hate to face Ashwin," said Gambhir. "Harbhajan was more beautiful to watch," stated the former Indian cricketer.

326.title: Ukraine's President Zelenskyy to address British parliament
326.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Tuesday will virtually address the British parliament. It will be the first time a foreign president addresses the House of Commons. "Every parliamentarian wants to hear directly from the president, who will be speaking to us live from Ukraine, so this is an important opportunity for the House," Speaker Sir Lindsay Hoyle said.

327.title: President Kovind confers 'Nari Shakti Puraskar' on 29 women
327.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind conferred the 'Nari Shakti Puraskar' on 29 women for 2020 and 2021, on International Women's Day on Tuesday. An initiative of Women and Child Development Ministry, the award recognises exceptional work towards women's empowerment. Social entrepreneur Anita Gupta, tribal activist Ushaben Dineshbhai Vasava and innovator Nasira Akhter, among others, were the latest awardees.

328.title: Raghavan is among the best filmmakers of Hindi cinema today: Sanjay
328.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor said that he is looking forward to working under filmmaker Sriram Raghavan's vision in the film 'Merry Christmas'. "Raghavan is one of the best filmmakers of Hindi cinema today," Sanjay added. The film also features Katrina Kaif and Vijay Sethupathi. "I have been in awe of his style of storytelling ever since I saw 'Badlapur'," Sanjay stated.

329.title: There's lot of diverse content across Hollywood today: Kal Penn
329.article_body: Actor Kal Penn stated there's a lot of diverse content in Hollywood currently than there was a decade ago "More great projects with...interesting, funny...diverse stories [are there] for audiences to enjoy, like 'Hot Mess Holiday'," he added. When asked about working in Bollywood, Penn said, "I'm trying to produce more in Bollywood, there's an exciting opportunity with the OTT platforms."

330.title: Clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency: FM
330.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the government sees "clear advantages in a central bank driven digital currency". She added that the digital rupee is a conscious call taken in consultation with RBI and that the government expects the digital currency to come out from RBI this year itself. "I see a possibility for revenue in [digital currency]," she said.

331.title: 4 dead, 2 injured after car collides with truck in UP's Kanpur
331.article_body: Four people were killed and two others were seriously injured after a car collided with a truck in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur district, police said. The incident occurred on Monday night when the car driver tried to overtake a vehicle but collided with the speeding truck coming from the opposite direction. The car was going towards Ghatampur, police said.

332.title: Apple's Russia exit may cost $3 mn/day in iPhone sales: Report
332.article_body: Apple might lose at least $3 million in iPhone sales revenue daily or $1.14 billion annually as it announced to pull out from the Russian market, Lithuania-based online shopping portal Burga reported. Apple accounts for 15% of the Russian smartphone sales to rank third overall. South Korea's Samsung occupies the top position with 34%.

333.title: Kumble would've taken over 1,000 int'l wickets with DRS: Kohli's coach
333.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said Anil Kumble would have taken more than 1,000 wickets in international cricket if he had DRS, having retired with 956 wickets. "During my time..., if the ball struck the pads of the batter while...on the front foot, the umpire would...give it not out," added Rajkumar. Kumble is India's top wicket-taker in Tests.

334.title: School uniforms worth ₹351 cr distributed to students during COVID in MP
334.article_body: Madhya Pradesh government distributed school uniforms worth ₹351 crore to over 1.17 crore students across 50 districts of the state during COVID-19 pandemic in financial year 2020-21, School Education Minister Inder Singh Parmar said. While "radio school" (online) was started for Classes 1 to 8, students from Classes 9 to 12 studied under "Hamara Ghar Hamara Vidyalaya" plan, he added.

335.title: To say that govt controlled oil prices due to polls is incorrect: Puri
335.article_body: Petroleum and Natural Gas Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday said oil prices are determined by global prices and "to say that the government had controlled oil prices due to elections is not correct". "We'll take decisions in the best interest of our citizens," he added. This comes after global oil prices reached close to the $140/barrel mark on Monday.

336.title: IMD issues yellow alert in parts of Maharashtra, Gujarat & MP
336.article_body: The IMD issued a yellow alert for Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat and Maharashtra forecasting thunderstorms for the next two days. The wind confluence and a trough in easterlies run from the southeast Arabian Sea off Kerala coast to Konkan coast in lower tropospheric levels and these conditions are likely to bring thunderstorms and rains in these states, the weather agency said.

337.title: Raipur journalist held for political satire now charged with prostitution
337.article_body: Nilesh Sharma, a journalist who was earlier arrested by Raipur Police for allegedly writing satirical articles on Congress MLAs, has now been charged with three new sections. According to the police, they have found pornographic content in Sharma's phone and have sent him to jail charging him with sections under the IT Act and prevention of immoral trafficking law.

338.title: Dish TV to move SAT against SEBI order to disclose its AGM voting results
338.article_body: Dish TV on Tuesday said it will move the Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) against SEBI's interim order directing Dish TV to disclose its annual general meeting's (AGM) voting results. SEBI had ordered Dish TV on Monday to disclose AGM results within 24 hours. It also issued show cause notices and directed depositories to freeze Demat accounts of the company's directors.

339.title: How will the new UPI work on feature phones and in offline mode?
339.article_body: To use RBI's UPI123Pay, users need to link their bank account with their feature phones and set up a UPI pin with a debit card. They can call an Interactive Voice Response number to transfer money. They can also use a missed call payment feature to send money to a merchant/shop or tap their phones on a sound-based payments device.

340.title: 15th round of India and China military talks on March 11: Reports
340.article_body: India and China will hold the 15th round of Corps Commander-level talks on March 11, reports claimed on Tuesday. The talks will be held at the Chushul Moldo meeting point in India. The 14 rounds of talks held so far have led to a resolution in the North and South Bank of Pangong Tso, Galwan and Gogra Hot Spring areas.

341.title: Bye bye, good riddance: Simon Jordan on Chelsea's Russian owner Abramovich
341.article_body: Terming Chelsea's Russian owner Roman Abramovich as one of the "worst things" for English football, ex-Crystal Palace owner Simon Jordan said, "[Abramovich's legacy] is awful...good riddance, bye bye." "He's part of a regime that's got a Mafioso boss that's gone mad...in Vladimir Putin," added Jordan. Swiss billionaire Hansjorg Wyss had earlier called Abramovich one of Putin's closest friends.

342.title: Swiggy hires JP Morgan, I-Sec for $800 mn-$1 billion IPO: Reports
342.article_body: Swiggy has hired two investment banks JP Morgan and ICICI Securities for the launch of its $800 million to $1 billion IPO, media reports said citing sources. Swiggy plans to offer about 10% stake in the IPO, which may be a mix of primary and secondary offering. It may file the DRHP with SEBI by June.

343.title: Bengaluru Police detects 7 cases of house break-ins & thefts
343.article_body: DCP (Bengaluru's Whitefield) S Girish took to Twitter on Monday and informed that Bellandur Police detected seven "important" cases of house break-ins and thefts in the city. Girish tweeted that the Bellandur Police was rewarded with appreciation certificates over the same. He also informed that the police recovered 500 grams of gold jewellery from the possession of an offender.

344.title: Income Tax raids premises linked to Aaditya Thackeray's aide
344.article_body: The Income Tax department carried out searches on premises linked to Shiv Sena leader Rrahul Narain Kanal, who is a close aide of Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray. The raid was conducted in connection with alleged tax evasion by BMC Standing Committee's Chairman Yashwant Jadhav. Kanal is a member of BMC's Education Committee and trustee of Shri Sai Baba Sansthan Trust.

345.title: 694 Indian students stuck in Ukraine's Sumy being evacuated: Govt
345.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri has confirmed that the evacuation process for Indian students stranded in Ukraine's Sumy city has started. The minister said, "Last night, I checked with the control room, 694 Indian students were remaining in Sumy. Today, they have all left in buses for Poltava." This comes after Russia announced ceasefire in five cities including Sumy.

346.title: For privilege we have, my father works hard every day: Big B's daughter Shweta
346.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan's daughter Shweta Nanda said that being in public eye is not easy. "For all privilege we have, my father, who will turn 80 this year, works hard every day...I have seen what goes behind everything. He wakes up at 5...is on the set, which is a tough world...Then you are picked on for every thing," she added.

347.title: Not going to play Tests again, so no point in playing first-class cricket: Finch
347.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch, who last played a first-class match in 2019, has said he doesn't see any point in playing Sheffield Shield cricket again as he's not going to play Test cricket anymore. "Unless you're pushing for a Test match, I don't really see the point," he stated. Finch last played a Test match in December 2018.

348.title: Ukraine’s youngest MP aged 26 takes up arms to fight Russia; posts pics with AK-47
348.article_body: Amid the war in the country, Ukraine's youngest Member of Parliament Sviatoslav Yurash has taken up arms to fight Russia.
