The 26-year-old has been posting pictures of him with an AK-47 assault rifle looped over one shoulder. "This is defining moment for our nation. We either fight and survive, to live on to next generation, or we fall," he said.

349.title: Wheelchair-bound B'luru professor accuses Air India of denying boarding
349.article_body: A wheelchair-bound professor at Bengaluru's Indian Statistical Institute has alleged that he was "humiliated" and denied boarding an Air India flight at Bengaluru airport on Monday. The professor, Kaushik Kumar Majumdar, alleged the Kolkata-bound flight's pilot asked him to remove his wheelchair battery. However, he told the pilot that it was "impossible," following this, he was denied boarding.

350.title: I went through a tough time after my father's death: Fardeen on Feroz Khan
350.article_body: Speaking about what kept him away from films for over a decade, actor Fardeen said he was going through a tough time after his father, actor Feroz Khan's death due to lung cancer in 2009. "I needed some time off...I had a little bit of a health scare myself in 2009 just a few months after his death," he added.

351.title: Co-star got scared, I can't remember: Bob on heart attack on 'Better...' set
351.article_body: American actor Bob Odenkirk who suffered heart attack on sets of 'Better Call Saul' in July last year said he does not remember anything about it. "She [co-star Rhea Seehorn] got scared, I wasn't scared...Can't help but think about it fair amount," Odenkirk said, adding, "Reaction I got from public and friends, it all affected me...it still will...and continues to."

352.title: Central agencies have become BJP's publicity machinery: Aaditya Thackeray
352.article_body: Reacting to the Income Tax department raids on premises of MVA leaders, Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray said that the central probe agencies have in a way become "publicity machinery" of BJP. "Maharashtra in the past has witnessed invasion. This is an invasion by Delhi," he added. "Maharashtra will not be scared nor will it bow down," Thackeray further said.

353.title: Ukraine starts evacuating civilians from Sumy, video shows people inside buses
353.article_body: Ukraine has begun evacuating civilians from Sumy as Russia opened humanitarian corridors. "We call on Russia to uphold...ceasefire commitment, to refrain from activities that endanger the lives of people and to allow the delivery of humanitarian aid," wrote Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs. "We call on Russia to agree on other humanitarian corridors," it tweeted while sharing a video.

354.title: SP candidate keeps vigil on strong room in Meerut through binoculars
354.article_body:
SP candidate from Hastinapur constituency in Meerut district, Yogesh Verma, has been 
camping outside the vote counting site at the Agriculture University in Meerut and is keeping an eye on EVM strong room with binoculars to prevent "mishandling". "SP chief has ordered to keep an eye on EVM strong room...We will work in three shifts of eight hours," Verma said.

355.title: Warne brought spin as attacking commodity to cricketing world: Ashwin
355.article_body: India off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has said that Shane Warne, who passed away last week, brought spin as an attacking commodity to the cricketing world. "He was a colourful character, he redefined bowling, took more than 1000 international wickets," added Ashwin on his YouTube channel. He further said, "Warne was a maestro...lived his life to the fullest."

356.title: BJP will be ousted the day people find a viable alternative: Mamata
356.article_body: West Bengal CM and TMC chief Mamata Banerjee on Tuesday said the BJP will be ousted from power the day people find an alternative. Speaking at TMC's organisational meet, Banerjee said opposition parties should come together to form the alternative force needed to oust BJP from power. TMC is supporting BJP rival Samajwadi Party in the ongoing UP Assembly polls.

357.title: NASA's Curiosity rover captures photo of tiny mineral flower on Mars
357.article_body: NASA shared a close-up picture of a tiny, flower-like mineral deposit on the surface of Mars captured by Curiosity rover. "It's a concretion, eroded from sedimentary rock that was cemented by mineral-rich groundwater," the rover's Twitter handle informed. The centimetre wide branching rock resembles a sponge or coral but is lifeless. It was likely formed when water still covered Mars.

358.title: Police create green corridor for transportation of live organs in Hyd
358.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Traffic Police created a green corridor for the transportation of a live heart and lungs from Kamineni Hospital in LB Nagar to KIMS Hospital in Begumpet. The ambulance covered 17.6 kilometres within 16 minutes without traffic obstructions, police said. "Ambulance started from Kamineni Hospital at 10.01 hours and reached KIMS Hospital at 10.17 hours," police added.

359.title: Sure that people have voted against arrogant govt: Cong's Hooda on exit poll
359.article_body: Reacting to the exit poll results of Assembly elections, Congress leader Deepender Hooda said, the party is sure that people have voted against the arrogant (central) government in all five states. "Congress will form government on its own in Uttarakhand, Punjab, Manipur and Goa. There'll be a change in UP and government will be formed with Congress' support," he added.

360.title: You'll always be my Hero: Rajkummar on his mother's 6th death anniversary
360.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao shared a post remembering his mother on her 6th death anniversary. Sharing a picture from his wedding with Patralekhaa, Rajkummar can be seen blowing a kiss to his mother's photo frame, he captioned it, "It's been six years Maa, since you left us but I know you are always there with me...You will always be my Hero."

361.title: May seek exception to EU sanctions on Russian gas & oil: Bulgaria PM
361.article_body: Bulgaria is supportive of EU sanctions on Russia but may seek an exception if they're imposed on Russian natural gas and oil supply, PM Kiril Petkov said on Monday. "We don't have...alternatives [for gas and oil imports] right now, we're too dependent," Petkov added. Over 60% of the fuel used in Bulgaria is reportedly produced by a Russia-owned oil refinery.

362.title: Intel's self-driving car unit Mobileye confidentially files for US IPO
362.article_body: Intel's self-driving car unit Mobileye confidentially filed for an initial public offering in the United States on Monday. The number of shares to be offered and the price range for the proposed offering have not yet been determined, Intel said. The chipmaker had originally purchased Israel-based company Mobileye in 2017 for $15.3 billion.

363.title: Puneeth's last movie 'James' to hit 4,000 screens on his birth anniversary
363.article_body: Late Kannada actor Puneeth Rajkumar's last film 'James' will be released in as many as 4,000 screens across India on his birth anniversary on March 17. The film will be released in Tamil, Hindi, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam languages. Puneeth is playing the role of a manager in a security company in the movie.

364.title: Cyberabad Traffic Police posts video of woman hit by 2-wheeler
364.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police shared a video of a road accident in Moinabad X road. In the video, a speeding two-wheeler can be seen hitting a woman who was crossing the road. "Taking your eyes off the road for two seconds is a big deal!" the Cyberabad Traffic Police captioned the video.

365.title: Who is Inspector Madhulatha, the 1st woman SHO appointed in Hyd?
365.article_body: Inspector K Madhulatha took charge as the station house officer of Hyderabad's Lallaguda Police Station on International Women's Day on Tuesday. The 2002-batch officer is the first woman officer to lead a law and order police station in Hyderabad. The 42-year-old was also the first woman officer to head the IT Corridor Women Police Station in the city.

366.title: Delhi Police dedicates Defence Colony station to women to mark Women's Day
366.article_body: Delhi Police dedicated the Defence Colony Police Station to women officers on Tuesday to mark International Women's Day. "Whether it's a case, whether it's a call, whether it's a complainant, lady staff will handle it today," DCP South Benita Mary Jaikar said. All ranks right from the SHO to the division and patrolling staff will be women, she added.

367.title: TN minister's daughter seeks B'luru Police's protection for self, husband
367.article_body: Jayakalyani, the daughter of Tamil Nadu minister and DMK leader PK Sekar Babu, has sought protection from Bengaluru Police for herself and her husband Satish Kumar. She alleged her family is against their relationship and had got Satish arrested earlier when they tried getting married. "I suspect...my father [is] behind this," she said, adding that they got death threats too.

368.title: Kohli played 2011 WC semi against Pakistan despite neck and jaw pain: Ex-India physio
368.article_body: Former Team India physio Ashish Kaushik has revealed that Virat Kohli played the 2011 World Cup semi-final against Pakistan in Mohali despite neck and jaw pain. Kaushik added, "Kohli would take everything extremely lightly and somehow know...he can work through it." "His pain tolerance is phenomenal...Kohli has got a tremendous ability to endure pain and look for solutions," he stated.

369.title: M&A in their early days: Harsh Goenka as he shares childhood pic of Ambani brothers
369.article_body: RPG Enterprises Chairman Harsh Goenka has shared a childhood photograph of Mukesh Ambani and Anil Ambani on Twitter and wrote, "Two brothers in their early days...M&A." The picture shows the two brothers dressed in formal suits with garlands around their necks. "Mukesh Ambani's looks are always constant," a Twitter user reacted to the picture.

370.title: Dog peed right by me as I celebrated Best Actor award win: Nakuul
370.article_body: Nakuul Mehta, who bagged the Best Actor-Television award for his show 'Bade Achhe Lagte Hain 2', at the Indian Television Awards 2022, said he celebrated his win by having kathi roll on the streets of Mumbai. "Whilst a passing stray dog, peed right by me. Gentle reminder by...universe that...the world may still not give a shit about you," he added.

371.title: Edtech unicorn Emeritus raises $350 million from CPP Investments
371.article_body: Edtech unicorn Emeritus has raised $350 million in debt financing from Canada Pension Plan Investment Board through its subsidiary CPPIB Credit Investments. After the funding's completion, Emeritus claims that it will have raised more than $1 billion in debt and equity. CPP Investments also participated in Emeritus' $650 million funding last year, which pushed Emeritus' valuation to $3.2 billion.

372.title: 70-year-old man found dead at home in UP's Greater Noida
372.article_body: A 70-year-old man was found dead at his home in Habibpur village in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida on Monday morning, police said. "Prima facie it appears that the man was strangulated. However, a post mortem report will confirm the cause of death," police added. The victim was involved in a property dispute with some relatives, police further said.

373.title: David Warner does bhangra on field during match against Pakistan, video goes viral
373.article_body: A video of Australia opener David Warner doing bhangra on the field during first Test against Pakistan in Rawalpindi has gone viral. "The crowd and the camera love Warner," the official account of Pakistan Cricket tweeted sharing the video. "Some entertainment in boring dead Test match," a fan commented on the video.

374.title: Unbelievably moved: Kristen Stewart on her 1st Oscar nomination
374.article_body: Actress Kristen Stewart has said that she was unbelievably moved after receiving an Oscar nomination for her film 'Spencer'. "I am truly astounded and unbelievably moved and touched and just stunned," she stated. Kristen has been nominated in the Best Actress category for her role as Princess Diana in the film. Kristen added that she loved the film.

375.title: Pune Metro trains to get dedicated ladies' coach 'Nari Shakti'
375.article_body: Pune Metro will soon run three-coach trains with a dedicated ladies' compartment called 'Nari Shakti', said Hemant Sonawne, Public Relation Officer of Pune Metro. The coaches will be equipped with CCTV cameras, charging sockets, air conditioning and emergency buttons, which will connect a passenger directly to loco pilot and station control room. The fares will be between ₹10-₹20, Sonawne added.

376.title: Delhi's maximum temperature likely to rise up to 34°C over next 6 days
376.article_body: The maximum temperature in Delhi will see a further rise in the next six days, the India Meteorological Department has said. The temperature is likely to rise up to about 32°C on March 13 and to 34°C by the next day. IMD said that the city is likely to record a high of 30°C on Tuesday.

377.title: Bengaluru bans protests near colleges, schools till March 22 amid hijab row
377.article_body: Amid the ongoing hijab controversy, Bengaluru Police Commissioner Kamal Pant has extended the ban on protests and gatherings within the 200-metre radius of schools, colleges, and other educational institutions till March 22. This is important to maintain public peace and order in Bengaluru, Pant said, adding the issue is still alive. The ban was first imposed on February 9.

378.title: Exit polls tactic to create mental pressure: RLD chief
378.article_body: Rashtriya Lok Dal (RLD) chief Jayant Chaudhary on Tuesday rejected exit poll predictions that said BJP will retain power in Uttar Pradesh. "I do not agree with...exit poll process," he told ANI. "The exit polls are an attempt to create mental pressure. It's a way to demoralise the people who want a change in the state," Chaudhary added.

379.title: Revenue Secy urges Customs officials to be cautious amid rise in drug hauls
379.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj on Monday urged officials of the Customs department to be cautious amid rise in drug hauls across the country. "The change in the geopolitical situation may actually see that we are getting more quantity than what we were getting earlier," Bajaj said during an investiture ceremony organised by the Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs.

380.title: Rapper-YouTuber Lil Bo Weep dies aged 22, father says 'She couldn't fight anymore'
380.article_body: Australian rapper-YouTuber Lil Bo Weep has died aged 22, her father Matthew Schofield confirmed in a Facebook post. "We lost the fight for my daughter's life against depression, trauma, PTSD and drug addiction that we have been fighting since we got her back from America through emergency repatriation DFAT but broken," he wrote. "She could not fight anymore," he added.

381.title: We were all saying Ashwin is struggling, his career is probably over: Sodhi
381.article_body: Talking about Ravichandran Ashwin becoming India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, ex-India all-rounder Reetinder Singh Sodhi said, "We were all saying that Ashwin is struggling, his career is probably over but that's not the case." "Anil Kumble has been my idol, so I'd want...Ashwin doesn't break his record [of 619 Test wickets]," added Reetinder. Ashwin has taken 436 Test wickets.

382.title: Domestic help jumps from 5th floor of building in Bandra, dies
382.article_body: A 30-year-old domestic help, Sarita Toko, jumped to her death from the fifth floor of a building in Mumbai's Bandra on Sunday. Toko hails from Jharkhand and had started working at a flat on the fifth floor last week. Her employers learnt of the incident only after a newspaper delivery person found her body in the compound, police said.

383.title: Nickel price more than doubles in a day, briefly hits $100,000 a tonne
383.article_body: Nickel price jumped as much as 111% on Tuesday to briefly surge above a record $100,000/tonne on London Metal Exchange (LME), before paring some gains. LME halted trading in nickel as brokers faced trouble in paying margin calls following the largest-ever price move on the exchange. This comes amid a rise in risk of shortages from Russia, following Ukraine's invasion.

384.title: Duplantis breaks his own pole vault world record for 2nd time in 2 years
384.article_body: Armand Duplantis of Sweden has set a new pole vault world record of 6.19 metres at the World Athletics Indoor Tour event in Belgrade, Serbia. This is the second time in two years that Duplantis has improved his own record by 1cm. In February 2020, he had broken his own record of 6.17 metres with a 6.18 metres clearance.

385.title: Geeta praises Virat for having Anushka next to him on 100th Test felicitation
385.article_body: Cricketer Harbhajan Singh's wife Geeta Basra spoke about Anushka Sharma being present on the ground when Virat Kohli was felicitated on his 100th Test match. She lauded Virat for having Anushka next to him and said he is changing rules. "It was...first time a cricketer's wife was next to her husband when he was being honoured on field," Geeta said.

386.title: 7 students from Pune district yet to return from Ukraine
386.article_body: Seven more students from Maharashtra's Pune district are yet to return from Ukraine as on Monday as three of them are in Poland, one is in Oman and three students are in transit. As many as 102 students from the district have been brought back. Pune District Collector Rajesh Deshmukh said the administration is in touch with the students.

387.title: Assam man burns wife alive for failing to meet dowry demands; held
387.article_body: A 40-year-old man allegedly burnt his wife alive in Moina in Assam's Karimganj district after her family failed to meet his demands for dowry, police said on Tuesday. The accused, Jamal Uddin, married the victim, Khudeja Begum, after his first wife left him and remarried. Begum used to live with her parents due to Uddin's dowry demands.

388.title: Shortfall of 19,128 classrooms in state-run schools: Gujarat Min
388.article_body: Responding to a set of questions raised by Congress MLAs, Gujarat Education Minister Jitu Vaghani informed the House that there was a shortfall of 19,128 classrooms in various state-run primary schools as of December 2021. The Gujarat government has also built 2,714 new classrooms during the last two years, Vaghani added. Dahod district topped the list of classrooms' shortfall.

389.title: India's economy picking up pace, reflecting reforms of our govt: PM Modi
389.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that India's economy is picking up pace after the COVID-19 pandemic and it is reflecting the fundamentals and reforms of the BJP-led Central government. "By encouraging foreign capital flows, reducing tax on infrastructure investment, creating institutions like NIIF, Gift City, new DFIs, we've tried to accelerate financial and economic growth," PM added.

390.title: Spoke to Warne 2 days before he went to Thailand, we planned to meet: Clarke
390.article_body: Ex-Australia captain Michael Clarke has said he talked to Shane Warne two days before he got on the plane for Thailand, where he died aged 52. "We spoke briefly about trying to get fit...the plan was...I would go and see him, he bought a new car, we both love cars. That's why it was an absolute shock," revealed Clarke.

391.title: Sanctions on India over Russian deal would be extraordinarily foolhardy: US politician
391.article_body: US Senator Ted Cruz responded to reports that Joe Biden-led US administration is contemplating to impose Countering America's Adversaries through Sanctions Act (CAATSA) against India over purchase of S-400 missile system from Russia. "Imposing CAATSA sanctions against India, the largest democracy on Earth...would be extraordinarily foolhardy," he said, adding that India is a critical ally.

392.title: I do therapy once a week, want to tell my younger self to relax: Alia Bhatt
392.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, in recent interview with journalist Barkha Dutt, said she goes to therapy once a week. "I am in the film industry and have been very hard on myself with regards to food and weight. I would tell my 18, 19, 20 year old self 'Just relax, put effort but don't be so hard on yourself'," she added.

393.title: Amazon's Chinese suppliers linked to forced labour camps: Report
393.article_body: Amazon's public list of Chinese suppliers includes five companies previously linked directly or indirectly to forced labour of ethnic minorities from China's Xinjiang region, Tech Transparency Project reported. The suppliers help produce Amazon-branded devices and products sold under house labels like Amazon Basics. Two of the suppliers named in the report were also reportedly used by Apple.

394.title: PMC presents draft budget of ₹8,592 cr, focus on more road networks
394.article_body: Pune Municipal Commissioner Vikram Kumar on Monday presented the civic body's draft budget of ₹8,592 crore for 2022-23, with a focus on creating more road networks in city. "Despite...Pune Metro being launched, we want to strengthen...public transport...Considering this, I have proposed six more...flyovers...and one bridge,” Kumar said. Many projects will be implemented via PPP model, he added.

395.title: Ashram underpass to be open from March 22: Delhi Deputy CM
395.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia on Monday said the Ashram underpass will be opened for the public from March 22 onwards. Sisodia recently also carried out an inspection of the construction site. Another underpass at Pragati Maidan will be ready for use by May while construction of the Ashram flyover will be completed by August, PTI quoted Sisodia as saying.

396.title: Huge rush of passengers on Pune Metro on 2nd day, pics surface
396.article_body: The newly operational Pune Metro witnessed a good turnout on the second day on Monday and a huge rush of people was seen in metro stations. The metro is operational on two routes-- from Garware college to Vanaz station and from Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation to Phugewadi. The facility is open to the public from 8 am to 9 pm.

397.title: Mumbai man jumps in front of train with son over joblessness; child dies
397.article_body: A Mumbai-based 32-year-old man reportedly tried to kill himself along with his three-year-old son by jumping in front of a train on Sunday. However, he survived the jump, but his son died. He was reportedly unemployed and often landed up in an argument with his wife over the same. Following this, he decided to end his life with his son.

398.title: Speeding dumper truck mows down woman on way to church in Mumbai
398.article_body: A 65-year-old woman died after a speeding dumper truck mowed her down in Mumbai's Malad on Sunday. The victim, Aliana Thomas, was on her way to the church when the incident happened. Reportedly, the driver, Mohammad Shafiq Ansari, lost control of the vehicle and hit Thomas who was walking on the roadside. She succumbed to her injuries during the treatment.

399.title: Leonardo DiCaprio donates $10 million for his grandmother's native land Ukraine
399.article_body: Hollywood actor Leonardo DiCaprio has donated $10 million to support Ukraine, which is fighting against Russia. The actor's maternal grandmother, Helene Indenbirken, was born in Odessa as Jelena Stepanovna Smirnova, as per Polish News. In 1917, she emigrated from there with her parents to Germany, where DiCaprio's mother was born.

400.title: Kuldeep Yadav released from India squad for pink-ball Test, Axar Patel returns
400.article_body: Chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav has been released from India squad for the pink-ball Test against Sri Lanka scheduled to take place from March 12 in Bengaluru. All-rounder Axar Patel has been added to India squad after being cleared by BCCI's medical team. Axar recently recovered from a shin injury and COVID-19.

401.title: We both went bald: Zerodha Co-founder's wife on their pic amid her chemotherapy
401.article_body: Zerodha Co-founder Nithin Kamath's wife Seema Patil, who was recently diagnosed with breast cancer and is undergoing chemotherapy, said she decided not to go for a wig as cancer's already a "taboo". "It...didn't feel right...so, we both went bald at the same time. Nithin has agreed to remain bald until my hair grows back again," she wrote, sharing their picture.

402.title: 9 killed after Russian aircraft bombed residential buildings in Sumy: Ukraine
402.article_body: At least nine people, including two children, have been killed after Russian aircraft bombed residential buildings in the Ukrainian city of Sumy on Monday night, Ukraine's State Emergency Service said. Several people have also been injured in the airstrikes in Sumy, which is near the Russian border. Russian aircraft also bombed cities in central Ukraine and destroyed buildings, officials said.

403.title: Pic shows 12-yr-old holding her crying sister while leaving mother behind in Ukraine
403.article_body: A picture showing a 12-year-old girl holding her crying sister as she waves their mother goodbye in Ukraine has surfaced online. "Alexandra, 12, holds her sister Esyea, 6, who cries as she waves at her mother Irina, while members of the Jewish community of Odessa board a bus to flee Russia's invasion of Ukraine, in Odessa, Ukraine," a journalist tweeted.

404.title: Over 75% of Amazon forest struggling to recover from wildfires, droughts: Study
404.article_body: Satellite images collected over the last two decades have found that over 75% of Amazon rainforest are likely struggling to recover from extreme climatic events like droughts, wildfires and logging among others. The study published in Nature Climate Change journal also stated that the rainforest may be nearing a "tipping point" of dieback, where the rainforest will turn to savanna.
